intro: Arisaema verrucosum var. utile, commonly known as the rough arum, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive,戟-shaped (spear-shaped) leaves and a spadix surrounded by a showy, hooded spathe. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into berries containing toxic seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
